channel.title: Support - Kicksecure Forums
channel.description: Topics in the 'Support' category User support for the Kicksecure operating system.

item.title: Is zsh the default shell globally for useradd?
item.dc:creator: init38
item.description:
When I create new users will it default to setting the shell as zsh?
Or do I have to manually edit passwd to set it?

Just curious as when I morphed a VM it would still default to sh when i created a new user.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Is zsh the default shell globally for useradd?

item.title: HELP - Error in ca-certificates don't allow update or install any package
item.dc:creator: doxasoj302
item.description:
The principal error is:

installed ca-certificates package post-installation script subprocess returned error exit status 132

I have tried to install Kicksecure 4 times yet. All time I get the same issue. Just after installation, I reboot, then select the second option of the grub, check for updates and then install updates.

In the process of upgrade certificates module throw errors in certifications of a lots packets, for example:

W: tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/pool/main/m/miscfiles/miscfiles_1.5%2bdfsg-4_all.deb: No system certificates available. Try installing ca-certificates.
E: Failed to fetch tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/pool/main/libh/libhttp-date-perl/libhttp-date-perl_6.05-2_all.deb  Certificate verification failed: The certificate is NOT trusted. The certificate issuer is unknown.  Could not handshake: Error in the certificate verification. [IP: 127.0.0.1 9050]

I have tried to reinstall ca-certificates, reconfigure dpkg, fix broken dependencies, install ca-certificates manually from debian website.

Nothing works…

I don’t have an old PC, I have been using Ubuntu in the same PC with the same hardware for 2 years.

I have tried to debug the issue and reinstall some packages but I can’t for the problem with certificates…

sudo apt install ca-certificates
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
ca-certificates is already the newest version (20230311+deb12u1).
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 28 not upgraded.
1 not fully installed or removed.
After this operation, 0 B of additional disk space will be used.
Do you want to continue? [Y/n] Y
Setting up ca-certificates (20230311+deb12u1) ...
Updating certificates in /etc/ssl/certs...
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
dpkg: error processing package ca-certificates (--configure):
 installed ca-certificates package post-installation script subprocess returned 
error exit status 132
Errors were encountered while processing:
 ca-certificates
E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (1)
zsh: exit 100   sudo apt install ca-certificates

Anyone know which could be the problem?

7 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: HELP - Error in ca-certificates don't allow update or install any package

item.title: Some questions before switching to kicksecure
item.dc:creator: cyanflorrie
item.description:
Hi

  1. Nvidia GPU drivers (non free)
    I’m currently using arch based endeavourOS distro and it’s very convenient in terms of I don’t really need to worry about the installation of Nvidia drivers.
    I tried to use debian and couldn’t/didn’t want to invest so much energy and time just to install a driver.
    How is the installation process of Nvidia drivers on kicksecure?

  2. I’m using plasma 6 and couldn’t find if kicksecure switched to plasma 6 or not

Thanks

4 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Some questions before switching to kicksecure

item.title: System upgrade fails due to tb-updater bug
item.dc:creator: gray
item.description:
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade fails due to tb-update bug.

Setting up tb-updater (3:39.0-1) ...
/usr/bin/update-torbrowser: line 442: /usr/bin/sanitize-string: No such file or directory

####################################################################
## BEGIN ERROR in /var/lib/dpkg/info/tb-updater.postinst detected!
##
## ERROR LOG:
## See above.
##
## BASH_COMMAND: $tool_item $chroot_maybe --postinst
## EXIT_CODE: 1
##
## END ERROR in /var/lib/dpkg/info/tb-updater.postinst detected!
## Please report this bug!
####################################################################

dpkg: error processing package tb-updater (--configure):
 installed tb-updater package post-installation script subprocess returned error exit status 1
Errors were encountered while processing:
 tb-updater
E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (1)
zsh: exit 100   sudo apt upgrade

5 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: System upgrade fails due to tb-updater bug

item.title: TOTP based Authenticators fail if sdwdate is not synced
item.dc:creator: init38
item.description:
Just wanted to post this here for other users that may using keepassxc with TOTP and it failing to spit out correct codes related to sdwdate issue bellow.

I went to set up TOTP inside keepassxc and it kept failing to give the right codes. This led me to figure out that the time has to be correct for it to work properly.

Since I was using a VPN auto connect it would sometimes cause sdwdate to time out due to [VPN → Tor → sdwdate] slow connection or whatnot.

Once I synced sdwdate the issue was resolved.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: TOTP based Authenticators fail if sdwdate is not synced

item.title: Wrong FDE password 3 times - System Halted
item.dc:creator: Wakanki
item.description:
Hello! So, as the title suggests, i acidenally typed the wrong password 3 times (FDE Password) and then the system started spitting this out after a bit of waiting:

dracut-initiqueue [6234]: failed to connect to bus: no such file or directory

reboot: system halted

From this moment on, my keyboard was not owrking and i could not type anything, so after waiting for 2 or so minutes, i held down the power button on my pc and it shut down. Then i re-did the process (Got the password right this time)
Could something have gone wrong? Should i re-install just to be safe or is my system fine as is?

6 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Wrong FDE password 3 times - System Halted

item.title: PureOS instead of Debian
item.dc:creator: Vitaly
item.description:
Dear developers,

Debian, of course, is a very good OS.
But unfortunately, it and its core contain blobs and proprietary firmwares.

Why don’t you switch to PureOS instead of Debian to improve the security of Kicksecure?
Project PureOS has an exceptionally clean kernel and no proprietary firmwares and drivers (and even an open BIOS).

5 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: PureOS instead of Debian

item.title: Update errors after disabling user-sysmaint-split and vpn install
item.dc:creator: farukar
item.description:
In order to hide the obvious use of TOR from my isp after install i disable the system split and install VPN.
but after i try to upgrade nonroot it spits out the following errors:

E: Release file for tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/bookworm-updates/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 3h 28min 51s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
E: Release file for tor+https://deb.debian.org/debian/dists/bookworm-backports/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 3h 28min 51s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
E: Release file for tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian-fasttrack/dists/bookworm-fasttrack/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 6h 48min 3s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
E: Release file for tor+https://fasttrack.debian.net/debian-fasttrack/dists/bookworm-backports-staging/InRelease is not valid yet (invalid for another 6h 48min 2s). Updates for this repository will not be applied.
zsh: exit 100 sudo apt update

when i do sudo apt update and upgrade it upgrades about 250mb of data witholding what i assume is the files that fail with the nonroot method

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Update errors after disabling user-sysmaint-split and vpn install

item.title: Use sdwdate without Tor Control port
item.dc:creator: UniksKorn25
item.description:
Hi.

I would like to use external Tor Socks Proxy with sdwdate at config file /etc/sdwdate.d/50_user.conf:

PROXY_IP=192.168.7.70
PROXY_PORT=9050

And have the error (Tor’s Control Port could not be reached):

[user ~]% sudo journalctl -fu sdwdate
...
Jul 01 10:07:58 localhost sdwdate[706393]: __ ### START: ### /usr/libexec/helper-scripts/onion-time-pre-script
Jul 01 10:07:58 localhost sdwdate[706393]: __ Status: Subsequent run after boot.
Jul 01 10:07:58 localhost sdwdate[706393]: __ Static Time Sanity Check: Within minimum time 'Wed May  7 00:00:00 UTC 2025' and expiration timestamp 'Tue May 17 10:00:00 UTC 2033', ok.
Jul 01 10:07:58 localhost sdwdate[706393]: __ Tor Bootstrap Result: Tor's Control Port could not be reached.
Jul 01 10:07:58 localhost sdwdate[706393]: __ ### END: ### Exiting with exit_code '1' indicating 'wait, show error icon and retry.'.
...

Sdwdate is still running, but there is no time synchronization, no any success line in log, like this one:

...
Jul 01 12:19:37 localhost sdwdate[291586]: 2025-07-01 09:19:37 - sdwdate - INFO - Success.
...

Is it possible to use sdwdate without Tor Control Port?

Or i could keep using my good old bash script for time synchronization behind a proxy as a temporary forced alternative?: (click for more details) Modified it for use with kicksecure: (click for more details)

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Use sdwdate without Tor Control port

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)

at line 1440 of file VBoxManageAppliance.cpp

item.title: Enterprise Laptop style WiFi Switch causes Permanent freeze
item.dc:creator: desi_fubu
item.description:
On my Dell Laptop it has a handy hardware WiFi Switch on the side that when switched/toggled it disables all Wireless (WWAN/WLAN/Bluetooth).

When booted from Live ISO (USB) on USER session or SYSMAINT session if I then go to toggle the WiFi switch to disable wireless at any given time it causes the system to permanently freeze. This is regardless if I connect to network first or not before toggling the switch.

To my knowledge Dell Laptops that are in the “Enterprise” category only come with these hardware style WiFi switches or these are just the ones that I have seen. I’m not sure about other brands but it’s nice for the obvious security reasons to disable wireless if you don’t need or are using wired Ethernet connection specifically as I’m doing.

Also why is rfkill not a included as a package or prepackages with the ISO?

9 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Enterprise Laptop style WiFi Switch causes Permanent freeze

item.title: Could UEFI/BIOS exploits/rootkits be a potential source of compromise?
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
Could UEFI/BIOS exploits/rootkits be a potential source of compromise?

Is there an API that is capable of briding the firmware(BIOS/UEFI) with an OS,

or a Hypervisor?

Is there a list of firmware exploit kits that allow for this type of API?

Is it possible to PXE boot a bootkit/rootkit, or an RTOS remotely?

Could this be done using something like IntelME?

Which network protocol/service would be used in this case?

Would this networking protocol be wired or wireless?

17 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Could UEFI/BIOS exploits/rootkits be a potential source of compromise?

item.title: Bug: Calamares installer, uncheck disk encryption can't press next
item.dc:creator: nOrphf
item.description:
Hi

When installing Kicksecure, if you select to erase disk and unselect encryption the two password box but encrypt is still selected.
If you press the tick mark again, the tick mark disappears, but you can’t press next, the button isn’t made clickable.

See more here:
https ://streamable.com/p8jnkd

Doing manual disk partitioning is the only way I have found to get past without disk encryption.

This is happening for both a Hyper-V, VirtualBox and Physical PC installation.
Selected language: English GB
selected timezone: Copenhagen (Locale en-GB, formats DK)
Selected keyboard: Danish (No dead keys)

Regards Lars.

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Bug: Calamares installer, uncheck disk encryption can't press next

item.title: Howto for Password Reset for Kicksecure Root Account
item.dc:creator: sarrox
item.description:
Helo,
Kicksecure is installed on a rather old MAC.
User- and Root (Sysmaint-) account have different passwords for login.
I don’t know why but anyhow the password for sysmaint seems to be wrong, so I can’t login. Access for user is still ok.
Obviously editing Recovery Mode like in other distros is no longer possible as a precondition to set a new password.
Is there another rather simple, direct way to reset the sysmaint password and set a new one?
Thanks for help in advance.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Howto for Password Reset for Kicksecure Root Account

item.title: Veracrypt containers do not open
item.dc:creator: Banebere
item.description:
The last time i played around with veracrypt was back in January, so i know they worked on whatever version was back then. When i try to open a container vera asks for admin password. When i press enter the password window closes but the container is not opening.
If i set up a password and enter it it says that the password is wrong.

I tried both the app image and installing it:
sudo apt install dirmngr software-properties-common apt-transport-https curl lsb-release ca-certificates -y

curl -fsSL https://notesalexp.org/debian/alexp_key.asc | gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /usr/share/keyrings/alexp_key.gpg > /dev/null

echo “deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/alexp_key.gpg] https://notesalexp.org/debian/$(lsb_release -sc)/ $(lsb_release -sc) main” | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/alexp.list

sudo apt update

sudo apt install veracrypt

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Veracrypt containers do not open

item.title: Mullvad-browser don't start with firejail
item.dc:creator: random
item.description:
Hello, i can’t use Mullvad-browser (deb) package with firejail i have this error when i try to start mullvad :

Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/c++
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/x-session-manager
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/rview
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/pinentry
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/iptables-restore
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/x-www-browser
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/c89
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/vimdiff
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/unlzma
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/iptables
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/traceproto
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzgrep
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/traceroute
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/brave-browser
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/awk
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/gnome-www-browser
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/traceroute6
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/x-terminal-emulator
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/vim
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/x-window-manager
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzless
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzmore
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/pinentry-x11
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/which
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/tcptraceroute
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/cpp
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ebtables
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/view
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/automake
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/arptables-save
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/pybabel
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzcat
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/arptables
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/open
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzcmp
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ip6tables-restore
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ebtables-restore
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/iotop
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/vi
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lft
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/pico
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/traceroute.sbin
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzegrep
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzfgrep
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/rvim
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/rmt
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/iptables-save
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/pager
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/mt
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/arptables-restore
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ip6tables
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/c99
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/aclocal
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/cc
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/editor
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ip6tables-save
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ebtables-save
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/lzdiff
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/nawk
Warning fcopy: cannot create symbolic link /etc/alternatives/ex

“start-mullvad-browser cannot be run using a symlink on this operating system”

How to reproduce this error on Kicksecure ?

  1. Install mullvad-browser using the official repository
  2. Install the last version of firejail (0.9.74) deb package
  3. Run : sudo firecfg
  4. Run : firejail mullvad-browser

I wonder if this error is coming from a hardening conf from Kicksecure or maybe the error is coming from firejail itself ? If the error is coming from firejail itself i’m sorry i will report this to them.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Mullvad-browser don't start with firejail

item.title: Libkmod: ERROR …/libkmod/libkmod-config.c:772 conf_files_filter_out: Directories inside directories are not supported: /etc/modprobe.d/virtualbox-dkms.conf
item.dc:creator: mcoll69
item.description:
As per usual I boot up the machine and turn the fans down… first command is

sudo modprobe i8k force=1

which unexpectedly gives this erro:

libkmod: ERROR …/libkmod/libkmod-config.c:772 conf_files_filter_out: Directories inside directories are not supported: /etc/modprobe.d/virtualbox-dkms.conf

only thing I can think is that I ran the KickSecure SystemCheck. I’ve looked to try and see what’s happening

ps aux | grep virtualbox

user 55689 0.0 0.0 6340 2060 pts/0 S+ 09:51 0:00 grep --color=auto virtualbox

so virtualbox appears not to be running

this is mildly alarming. any help would be greatly appreciated.

7 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Libkmod: ERROR …/libkmod/libkmod-config.c:772 conf_files_filter_out: Directories inside directories are not supported: /etc/modprobe.d/virtualbox-dkms.conf
